articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
For some, it may come as a surprise that Israel stands among the global leaders in medicinal cannabis research. Discoveries made in the footsteps of Raphael Mechoulam (the internationally acclaimed researcher who first isolated THC) have brought new meaning to medical cannabis as strains are engineered to contain optimal levels of cannabinoids.
Here are just a few strains from the Israeli cannabis supplier Tikun Olam that we recently added to the Leafly Explorer. Most of them are low- to moderate-THC and high-CBD, meaning they offer imperceptible psychoactive effects but strong medical relief from pain symptoms. One strain, however, is a balanced blend of low-to-moderate THC and CBD. Enjoy!
1. Avi-Dekel
Characteristics of Avi-Dekel:

Sativa-dominant
Tests up to 16.3% CBD
Non-psychoactive; THC content as low as 0.8%
May treat inflammation, sleep disorders, and indigestion

2. Midnight
Characteristics of Midnight:

Sativa-dominant
Tests up to 12.4% CBD
THC content of about 12.7%
Controls pain, inflammation, and indigestion

3. Eran Almog
Characteristics of Eran Almog:

80% indica
Tests up to 28% THC
May treat sleep disorders, nausea, inflammation, pain, and indigestion

4. El-Na 
Characteristics of El-Na: 

A 50/50 hybrid 
Balanced THC (as low as 8.2%) and CBD (up to 6.5%) for patients unaccustomed to psychoactive effects
Good for pain, nausea, and stress relief 

5. Rafael 
Characteristics of Rafael: 

Sativa-dominant 
High CBD; up to 18.6% 
Low THC; as low as 1%

photo credit: RonAlmog via photopin cc
articles.title: 5 Great Pain Relief, High-CBD Cannabis Strains from Israel

description: Avi-Dekel is a sativa-dominant strain developed by Tikun Olam to contain high levels of CBD and almost no THC. Its CBD content, reaching as high as 15.8 percent, is intended to treat inflammation as well as sleep and digestive disorders. Avi-Dekel is ideal for patients seeking relief without the psychoactive effects of THC.
descriptionPlain: Avi-Dekel is a sativa-dominant strain developed by Tikun Olam to contain high levels of CBD and almost no THC. Its CBD content, reaching as high as 15.8 percent, is intended to treat inflammation as well as sleep and digestive disorders. Avi-Dekel is ideal for patients seeking relief without the psychoactive effects of THC.

highlightedReviews.text:
Since I have GAD I decided to give this strain a try. My Licensed Producer is MedReleaf. When I first opened the container a sweet, pungent smell hit my nose. My batch had 15% CBD and .89 % THC. It has a beautiful aroma and when vaporized it actually tastes a bit like sweet tarts. :) This strain effectively relieved my chronic pain from scoliosis and also calmed my anxious mind. There is no psychoactive effect from this strain, just an overall good feeling. You could have a puff of this and go about your work. No one would even know you were medicated! 

In the evening if I'm relaxing I tend to mix this and a high THC Indica. It's a very therapeutic high that creates a unique sensation. 

Definitely worth trying!

Flower/ 2 hits

PROS: works surprisingly well for inflammation 
-doesn't get you high

CONS:
-smoke is harsh
-gave me a short term headache 
-brain felt foggy (not stoned)

It really helped with inflammation of my joints from rock climbing and my arthritis. You will still feel your joint pains but helped reduce it a lot. Harshness of smoke might be avoided by vape. The trade off of the headache is why I rate this a 3 mostly. That and the brain fog. It's not a stoned feeling. More of a "I can't think straight in the morning cause I haven't had my coffee".

name: Avi-Dekel
